description:
Illumination is seeking an experienced Project Manager, Creative for style guide creation, Global Softlines product development, and Gaming to join our Marketing team. This unique role combines extraordinary organization skills with an eye toward details and creative deliverables. This position will guide, collaborate and communicate daily with a dynamic creative team at Illumination, Illumination Studios Paris and our partners at Universal as well as potential partners and agencies.

Style Guide / Global Softlines Product Development:
* Partner with Creative leads to ensure seamless management and tracking of global film & franchise guides from inception to final assets delivery
* Manage the development process of logos, character poses, patterns, graphics, design, patterns, product samples, etc.
* Help facilitate and manage Global Softlines product development submissions
* Maintain current project list/job status sheet for all style guide project
* Support the management of workload of internal design team and outside vendors
* Track deliverables against production timelines & schedulesCommunicate delivery dates to key stakeholders

Creative Budget:
* Track Creative expenses for all projects
* Request estimates from vendors and create Cost Summaries
* Process invoices

Project Management:
* Partner with VP, Creative re: agenda for weekly Tuesday meetings
* Notes and Recap of weekly meetings
* Lead weekly CPG Team meeting
* Track follow-ups from weekly meetings
* Special projects
* Other duties as needed

Gaming:
* Partner with Director of Business Development and VP of Development & Creative Strategy to ensure seamless management and review of multiple gaming platform submissions
* Maintain current project list/job status for all projects on Airtable
* Manage the development process of all assets for gaming
* Support the management of workload of Director of Business Development, VP of Development & Creative Strategy and outside vendors
* Facilitate character art development
* Track deliverables against production timelines & schedules

Qualifications:
* 5+ years related experience
* Licensing Creative Development preferred
* Product development cycle experience in softlines, toys or related goods desired
* Strategic, critical thinker and creative problem solver
* Strong organizational skills, ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects at one time
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Self-motivated & enjoy a fast-paced changing environment
* Curious collaborator who likes to brainstorm, contribute and participate in ideation
* Proficient in Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint and/or Keynote
* Proficient in Adobe Suite specifically but not exclusively Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Acrobat
* Proficient in Airtable and Lucidchart
* BA/BS or equivalent experience

The salary range for this position is $90,000-$95,000/year. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and an offer will consider various factors including experience, qualifications, skills, and training. Our comprehensive and competitive benefits package includes medical, dental and vision insurance for employees and their family, 401(k), paid time off, tuition reimbursement and a variety of other perks.

About Illumination

Illumination, founded by Chris Meledandri in 2007, is one of the entertainment industry’s leading producers of event-animated films, including Despicable Me—the most successful animated franchise in cinematic history—as well as Dr. Seuss’ The Lorax, Dr. Seuss’ The Grinch and The Secret Life of Pets and Sing films. The 2023 release of Illumination's The Super Mario Bros. Movie has joined the studio library, now comprising three of the top 10 animated films of all time. Illumination’s iconic, beloved franchises—infused with memorable and distinct characters, global appeal and cultural relevance—have grossed more than $9 billion worldwide. Illumination has an exclusive financing and distribution partnership with Universal Pictures.

Illumination is based in Santa Monica, CA and its studio, Illumination Studios Paris, is located in the center of Paris, France.

Illumination's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. Illumination will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with relevant legal requirements, including the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative For Hiring Ordinance, where applicable.
